title: Apply navy/slate/gold palette via existing Tailwind OKLCH theme variables (no layout changes)

requirements.summary: Update global OKLCH theme/color variables to the new navy/slate/gold palette and ensure legacy brand utilities render the new primary.
acceptanceCriteria: Global theme variables in frontend/src/index.css are updated to reflect the new palette, using OKLCH variables consistent with the existing implementation.
Any existing references to the old brand color variable (e.g., --theiarco-primary and any derived utilities) now render as the new primary navy (#003057).
No layout changes occur; only colors change across the app.

file_operations.description: Update :root and .dark OKLCH CSS variables to reflect the new palette: primary (#003057), secondary (#5B8FA3), accent (#F4A82E), dark-surface text (#FFFFFF), and neutral gray (#A8A9AD). Keep the existing variable-driven approach; update --theiarco-primary to match the new primary and ensure existing custom utilities (e.g., .bg-theiarco-primary, .text-theiarco-primary) inherit the new color without per-component hex usage.

Extend Tailwind color tokens (still variable-driven via OKLCH) to expose any needed semantic colors for the new palette (e.g., a neutral gray token aligned to #A8A9AD) while preserving existing mappings. Do not introduce per-component hex usage; keep the project’s CSS-variable approach.

requirements.summary: Restyle the header/navigation to use the new primary navy background with readable foreground contrast, without changing layout or behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The header bar uses the navy primary as its background color.
Header title and controls remain readable (sufficient contrast) against the navy background.
Header spacing, height, and interactions (menu toggle, logout) are unchanged.

file_operations.description: Switch header container styling from card background to the theme’s primary background and update title/control colors to use the appropriate theme foreground tokens (e.g., primary-foreground) for contrast. Keep structure, spacing, and event handlers unchanged.

requirements.summary: Update sidebar active nav item styling to use the new primary navy background with readable active foreground, without changing navigation behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Active sidebar link background renders as #003057 (via existing utility/variable approach).
Active sidebar link text/icons render with readable contrast (white on navy).
Hover/inactive styles remain functionally the same, only color-adjusted to fit the new palette.

file_operations.description: Update the active Link class styling to use the theme primary background/foreground tokens (variable-driven) rather than relying on legacy brand utilities. Preserve existing hover/inactive behavior while harmonizing colors with the new palette.

If needed to support REQ-3 without touching UI library internals, add/adjust variable-driven utility classes for brand/primary usage so sidebar active styling resolves to the new primary navy with correct contrast.

requirements.summary: Ensure primary button styling across the app uses the new primary navy with complementary hover/focus/active states aligned to the slate secondary, without changing button behavior or sizing.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary button backgrounds render as #003057 and text remains readable (white on navy where applicable).
Hover/focus/active states are updated to complementary palette shades and remain visually distinct from the default state.
No button functionality, placement, or sizing changes occur.

file_operations.description: Adjust theme variables that drive shadcn/Tailwind button colors (e.g., --primary, --primary-foreground, --ring, and any related tokens used for focus) so default, hover, and focus states reflect the new navy/slate palette via OKLCH variables. Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui.

Replace per-button brand class usage (e.g., bg-theiarco-primary) with theme token classes (e.g., bg-primary text-primary-foreground, plus appropriate hover/focus styles) so primary actions reflect the updated palette consistently while preserving layout and behavior.

requirements.summary: Update dashboard stat card background colors to navy/slate/gold combinations via existing dashboard stat CSS variables, keeping layout/typography/interactions unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard stat cards that currently use custom CSS variables (e.g., bg-dashboard-stat-*) are updated so their backgrounds reflect the new navy/slate/gold palette.
Stat card text remains readable (good contrast) on the updated backgrounds.
Card layout, counts, labels, and link behavior remain unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the existing --dashboard-stat-* OKLCH variables (light and dark) so bg-dashboard-stat-1/2/3/4 and the uncompleted/green variants harmonize with the new navy (#003057), slate (#5B8FA3), and gold (#F4A82E) palette while preserving readability.

Verify stat card classes remain mapped to bg-dashboard-stat-* utilities and adjust only where necessary to ensure contrast (text/icons remain readable) while keeping markup, layout, and link behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Harmonize semantic status badge shades (green/red/orange) with the new palette using variable-driven tokens, preserving meanings and readability.
acceptanceCriteria: Status badges still appear green/red/orange by meaning, but their shades are adjusted to look cohesive with the new palette.
Badge text remains readable on each badge background in both light and dark modes (where applicable).
No badge wording or logic changes occur (only styling).

file_operations.description: Introduce or adjust variable-driven semantic colors for status states (success/ok, warning, danger) in both light and dark themes using OKLCH variables (no inline hex per component). Ensure matching foreground variables for contrast.

Expose the new semantic status color tokens (e.g., success/warning/danger + their foregrounds) as Tailwind colors mapped to the CSS variables so badges can use consistent classes without editing frontend/src/components/ui. Keep existing theme mappings intact.

Replace hardcoded Tailwind colors (e.g., bg-green-600, bg-gray-*) with the new variable-driven semantic status/neutral classes so the badge remains readable and cohesive. Do not change badge logic or wording.

Audit and replace any hardcoded green/red/orange/gray status badge styling with the new variable-driven semantic badge classes to keep semantics the same while harmonizing shades. Keep layout and logic unchanged.

Audit status badge styling (if present) and update any hardcoded semantic colors to the new variable-driven semantic badge classes for cohesive green/red/orange shades, without changing behavior or layout.

requirements.summary: Ensure readable contrast across light/dark themes by updating foreground tokens associated with primary/secondary/accent and muted/brand usages.
acceptanceCriteria: Text on navy backgrounds renders as white (#FFFFFF) where intended and remains legible.
Accent (gold) usage does not reduce readability of overlaid text; foreground values are adjusted accordingly.
No new UI regressions where text becomes low-contrast due to palette changes.

file_operations.description: Update theme foreground variables (e.g., --primary-foreground, --secondary-foreground, --accent-foreground, --muted-foreground, and any brand-specific foreground usages) in both :root and .dark to ensure legible text/icons on their respective backgrounds after applying the new palette.
Align header text/icon classes to the updated theme foreground tokens (e.g., primary-foreground) to guarantee contrast on the navy header background without altering spacing or behavior.
Ensure active/inactive/hover sidebar text/icon classes leverage the updated theme foreground tokens so navigation remains legible in both themes, without changing layout or routing behavior.
